Seen many of those asian buffet places around the world,  but seldom have i seen this amount of choice in dishes to try. Overall atmosphere seems ok when you enter but soon becomes one of a school cafeteria with lines of tables. Staff could be a bit frienlier but service was not pushing for extra drinks after the first. No photos allowed,  so no party pics. Quality of food is decent but as all buffets not top quality meats. But with a price of 16 euro you get what you  pay for. Ready dishes,  cooked on the plancha your chosen raw ingredients and sushi for the mains and a choise of desserts and icecream. Would i go again?  Yes and no.  Alone no, but with a seafood lover for sure
